args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor Chapter 8 of the main campaign.
Well? What have you to say for yourself?
Tobias cannot possibly be a heretic!
An inquisitor's job is to determine\nsuch facts for themselves.
...Greetings. My name is Curran,\nand I am the inquisitor for your case.
What would be the point? I'm well aware\nthat judgment has already been rendered\nfor those accused of heresy.

For most inquisitors, that's sadly true.
But I believe in judging heretics fairly,
which means approaching them with
an open mind and heart.
I would hear the truth from you.
That's an interesting stance\nfor an inquisitor.
Perhaps we can start by reading your file.\nTell me if you hear any mistakes.
Your name is Paladyn Tobias.\nYou were born the son of a bishop.

After being named Paladyn, you took part
in the civil war at the Belitz diocese. After
helping to quell it, you were assigned to
serve a cardinal. Are we good so far?

Later, you were given a variety of tasks,
including escorting priests through
dangerous regions and educating
new recruits.
But these tasks all had one thing in\ncommon: they concerned the perditionists.
Do you sympathize with their claims, then?\nDo you believe the Other to be Ilia's child?
Your dismissive tone makes clear your\nbelief that the Scrolls of Perdition are\nnaught but heretical apocrypha.
I side with no faction—only the truth.

Back to it, then! After a meeting of the
Ecclesiastical Council, you were relieved
of your post and assigned to a lesser
position at the Mistell diocese.
To go from serving a cardinal to tending\nshop in the middle of nowhere is\na rather sudden demotion, is it not?
That does not concern this inquisition.\nHowever, all you have said so far is true.\nPlease continue, if you would.
While you were in the Mistell diocese,\nyou injured a dragon living in the woods.
Recite the creed of the Ilian Church,\nPaladyn Tobias.
＂Respect both Ilia and dragonkind,\nand guide all people to prosperity.＂
Any mewling babe could tell you such.
Then you were fully aware of your actions\nwhen turning your blade on that dragon?
Inflicting harm upon the creatures you are\nsworn to revere is a crime against Ilia.
Well? What have you to say for yourself?
I acted as I must. I did my duty.
I am very serious, Inquisitor Curran.
You just admitted that our duty is to\nrevere dragons, yet you attacked one!
Do you not see the contradiction?
Even the teachings of Ilia\nare open to interpretation.
But the makings of heresy are not.

When a layman does wrong, they pay
a fine. Maybe spend a little time in jail.
But when a Paladyn does wrong...
they are burned alive.
Having been reminded of this, is there\nany aspect of your story you would like\nto change or elaborate upon?
My unwavering stance is proof of my faith.
I'll not change it for you or anyone,\nno matter what fires await me.
I refuse to believe this, Tobias! I won't!
Very sorry, sir! I tried to stop her,\nso I did, but blimey, she's strong!
Why, Tobias? Why have you\nbeen branded as heretic?
But there must have been a REASON!
The only reason for any of\nmy actions is my belief.
Our belief is in the will of the Goddess Ilia!\nWhy would you hurt one of her creatures?!
Why won't you talk to me?!
This discussion is over.\nI have nothing further to say.
Because the answer does not concern you.\nDo not involve yourself in this, Elisanne.
Inquisitor Curran? Kindly escort the\nPaladyn from here, if you would.
I thought you'd be stubborn, but this...\nFair enough. We'll pick it up tomorrow.
I won't let you do this, Tobias!
Kindly keep her from here in the future\nif you would, my good man.
Cor, I don't take no orders from heretics!\nNow just sit there and don't try none'a\nyer witchy tricks, ya hear?
I have no plans to run or hide, sir.\nI will remain here, no matter the outcome.
Three days remain until Tobias's trial...
